bibl.title: Thomas S. Brown and et al. v. Thomas Jefferson Hamilton. Order Discharging Defendants
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: In the District County of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle
In the matter of the applicationof Thomas S. Brown etal. for Habeas Corpus + Discharge

This cause coming on to be heard upon the return of T.J. Hamilton to the Writ of Habeas Corpus hereto for issued herein, and Thomas S. Brown, G. Geord, George Downing, Chas Schubard, Carl Jong Matson known as C.J. Young and Peter J. Wegner being in open court attended by their counsel Miss Metcalfe + Rochester and Lewis and Gilman and the United States appearing by its counsel Charles F. Munday Esq. Assistant United States District Attorney, and said T.J. Hamilton having returned said Writ into Court with his doings thereon and the cause of the detention of said defendants herein named

and it appearing to the court that said persons were and are illegally and wrongfully restrained of their liberty by said T.J. Hamilton and the court being sufficiently advised it is considered by the Court that said Thomas S. Brown, G. Geods George Downing, Charles Schubard, Carl John Matson known as C.J. Young and Peter J. Wegner be and they are hereby discharged from custody and that they go hence without day and that they recover their costs herein expanded + may have execution
